sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not distributive over complement.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {3, 4}. Using the set complement operation, find (A∪B)' and (A×B)', then verify that the Cartesian product of the complements is not equal to the complement of the Cartesian product, i.e., (A'×B') is not equal to (A×B)'.
